pull.title: rpc: Note in fundrawtransaction doc, fee rate is for package
pull.body: Accidentally made some transactions with a much higher fee rate than I wanted because I did not know this would do it for the package rather than the individual tx.

events.body:

tree 5be1041cc8ec345b2a7197864b32208b4279565d

author benthecarman <benthecarman@live.com> 1748039306 -0500

rpc: Note in fundrawtransaction doc, fee rate is for package

events.message: rpc: Note in fundrawtransaction doc, fee rate is for package

events.body:
ACK fe0432b1c4a10b74844c2dedefccfe340c0d3b10

This is a good note, helpful. I verified in the code that the outputs selected in the transaction have a corresponding `ancestor_bump_fees` param that is used in calculating the `TotalBumpFees` inside `CreateTransactionInternal` function.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/638a4c0bd8b53766faeb437244b2aae4eed28dcf/src/wallet/coinselection.h#L75-L76

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/638a4c0bd8b53766faeb437244b2aae4eed28dcf/src/wallet/spend.cpp#L1251-L1257

Interesting that the `feature_fee_estimation.py ` test fails in the CI coincidentally but seems unrelated to me as it passed in my system. Maybe a rerun/push would fix it?

> Interesting that the `feature_fee_estimation.py ` test fails in the CI coincidentally but seems unrelated to me as it passed in my system. Maybe a rerun/push would fix it?

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32461

ACK fe0432b1c4a10b74844c2dedefccfe340c0d3b10

This will be a helpful note for someone using the rpc.

> Is this actually intended behaviour?

Yes, see #26152

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -758,6 +758,9 @@ RPCHelpMan fundrawtransaction()
                 "in the wallet using importdescriptors (to calculate fees).\n"
                 "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
                 "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n",
+                "Note that if specifying an exact fee rate, the resulting transaction may have a higher fee rate\n"
+                "if the transaction has unconfirmed inputs, this is because the wallet will attempt to make the\n"
+                "entire package have the given fee rate, not the resulting transaction."
                 {
comments.body:
```suggestion
                "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n"
                "Note that if specifying an exact fee rate, the resulting transaction may have a higher fee rate\n"
                "if the transaction has unconfirmed inputs, this is because the wallet will attempt to make the\n"
                "entire package have the given fee rate, not the resulting transaction.",
                {
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -758,6 +758,9 @@ RPCHelpMan fundrawtransaction()
                 "in the wallet using importdescriptors (to calculate fees).\n"
                 "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
                 "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n",
+                "Note that if specifying an exact fee rate, the resulting transaction may have a higher fee rate\n"
+                "if the transaction has unconfirmed inputs, this is because the wallet will attempt to make the\n"
+                "entire package have the given fee rate, not the resulting transaction."
                 {

@@ -757,7 +757,10 @@ RPCHelpMan fundrawtransaction()
                 "Note that all inputs selected must be of standard form and P2SH scripts must be\n"
                 "in the wallet using importdescriptors (to calculate fees).\n"
                 "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
-                "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n",
+                "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n"
comments.body: I see it needs a full stop after `watch-only`.
